data.title: Newberry College
data.meta_description: Newberry College is a small liberal arts college with a beautiful 90-acre campus in Newberry, South Carolina.
data.text:
Registered Student Organizations

Join an Organization

Newberry College offers over 30 organizations altogether to enrich your life outside the classroom. Choose from a wide variety of religious, athletic, philanthropic, and special interest organizations. Keep up on the latest news on Instagram at @newberrystudents.

Academic/Professional Organizations

American Chemical Society

Future Medical Professionals' Association

National Association for Music Education

Newberry Education Society

Phi Beta Lambda (Business)

Student Nurses' Association

Student Government Association

The Student Government Association is an assembly of elected and appointed delegates who represent the interests of the student body. SGA recognizes and funds student organizations, holds town hall meetings, elects professors and staff members of the year, and speaks on behalf of the student body in various aspects of campus life. Currently, nine members are elected annually by the student body, and nine are appointed to represent fraternities and sororities, campus ministries and student athletes, among others.

Diversity & Cultural Organizations

Black Student Union (BSU)

Newberry International Students Organization (NISO)

Honor Societies

Alpha Alpha Alpha (First-Generation Honors Society)

Alpha Kappa Delta (Sociology)

Alpha Lambda Delta (First-Year Success)

Alpha Phi Sigma (Criminal Justice)

Blue Key Honor Society

Delta Omicron International Music Fraternity

Omicron Delta Kappa Leadership Honor Society

Phi Alpha Theta (History)

Pi Mu Epsilon (Mathematics)

Sigma Tau Delta (English)

Greek Life

Fraternities & Sororities

You may choose to enhance your Newberry College experience with the unique opportunities of Greek Life. Fraternities and sororities promote scholarship, provide leadership opportunities, build lasting friendships, encourage community service and philanthropy, and allow for social and athletic opportunities. The Office of Greek Life currently advises 11 fraternities and sororities.

Follow @ncgreeklife on Instagram to keep up with the Newberry College Greek Life experience!

Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc.

The mission of an Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc., is "to cultivate and encourage high scholastic and ethical standards, to promote unity and friendship among college women, to study and help alleviate problems concerning girls and women to improve their social stature, to maintain a progressive interest in college life, and to be of Service to All Mankind." Click here to learn more about Alpha Kappa Alpha.

Alpha Xi Delta

The ladies of Alpha Xi Delta are focused on being successful, well-rounded ladies that spread love and happiness through their actions while working with their major philanthropy, Autism Speaks and perpetuating fraternal growth. Click here to learn more about Alpha Xi Delta.

Beta Sigma Psi | interest group

The mission of Beta Sigma Psi is to promote an organization of communicant Lutheran men who recognize that life rooted with Christ in God is the only true goal of human existence, and who, therefore, foster, encourage, and inspire activities and relationships which promote this end. Click here to learn more about Beta Sigma Psi.

Kappa Alpha Order | interest group

The brothers of Kappa Alpha Order present incredible opportunities for building leadership with the strong bonds of brotherhood they have developed, by living together, growing together, and learning about each other in a positive and healthy environment. Click here to learn more about Kappa Alpha Order.

Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc.

The brothers of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc. around the world participate in community outreach activities to feed the homeless, provide scholarships to young people matriculating to college, serve as mentors to young men, participate in blood drives and serve as hosts of seminars for public health awareness. Click here to learn more about Kappa Alpha Psi.

Kappa Delta

The sisters of Kappa Delta strive for that which is honorable, beautiful and highest while hosting several Girl Scout events throughout the year along with their Shamrock Week, benefitting Prevent Child Abuse America. Click here to learn more about Kappa Delta.

Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc.

Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc. was created to bring about union of college men of similar high ideals of scholarship and manhood in order to occupy a progressive, helpful and constructive place in political life of the community and nation. Click here to learn more about Omega Psi Phi.

Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Inc.

The brothers of Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Inc. strive to ensure that newly acquired skills through higher education can be used to benefit the diverse communities from which they had come. Click here to learn more about Phi Beta Sigma.

Sigma Gamma Rho, Sorority, Inc.

It is the mission of Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Inc. to enhance the quality of life for women and their families in the U.S. and globally through community service, civil, and social action. Our goal is to achieve greater progress in the areas of education, health awareness, and leadership development. Our members, affiliates, staff, and community partners work to create and support initiatives that align with our vision. Click here to learn more about Sigma Gamma Rho, Sorority, Inc.

Sigma Sigma Sigma

The sisters of Sigma Sigma Sigma hope to provide an experience for women through ensuring a perpetual bond of friendship, to develop in them strong womanly character while participating in philanthropic efforts for Sigma Serves Children, Robbie Page Memorial and March of Dimes. Click here to learn more about Sigma Sigma Sigma.

Theta Chi

The brothers of Theta Chi are a diverse group of young men with all brothers sharing the common goals of serving their god, their country, and their fellow man by participating in philanthropic events benefitting the USO, and locally, The Boys’ Farm. Click here to learn more about Theta Chi.

Campus Ministry

Living in God's Amazing Grace

As you explore and grow in your faith, campus ministry can provide fun activities, a sense of community, and a spiritual education. Everyone -- regardless of faith tradition, church affiliation, or age -- is invited to be a part of campus ministry at Newberry College.

Wednesday Chapel

Each week classes are in session, Wednesday Chapel offers the College community a chance to stop, reflect, and be inspired by God's Word and works. Our 40 minute services are held Wednesdays at 10 a.m. in Wiles Chapel.

Fellowship of Christian Athletes (FCA)

The Fellowship of Christian Athletes offers weekly student-led faith discussions and fellowship for all students, regardless of church affiliation or athletic participation. Meetings are held at 9 p.m. each Monday, in varying locations across campus.

Wolves Pantry

Wolves Pantry, located in Weber Campus Ministry House, offers meal solutions for students, faculty and staff experiencing food insecurity. Whether it’s a recurrent necessity or an occasional gap, this resource is available for all. Click here to learn more and get involved.

Campus Recreation

Newberry College is committed to providing students with a wide variety of sport-related activities to help promote a positive outlook and a healthy lifestyle. Whether you work out at the fitness center, compete in intramural leagues, take a group exercise class, or participate in other activities and health-related contests throughout the year, the Office of Campus Recreation is committed to programming that supports your social, mental and physical well-being. For more information, contact Kendall Powell at 803.321.5247 or email Kendall.Powell@newberry.edu.

Esports

Newberry College is proud to offer esports as an intercollegiate sport, having first launched in 2019. The program's home is Apex Arena, located in Wright Hall and equipped with state-of-the-art gaming computers. Wolves esports competes in "Call of Duty," "Fortnite," "League of Legends," "Madden," "Overwatch," "Rocket League," and "Valorant." The program is affiliated with the National Association of Collegiate Esports and the New England Collegiate Conference.

Scholarships Available

As a Newberry Wolves esports competitor, you may be eligible for athletic scholarships. Click here to learn more about our generous financial aid program.

If you are interested in joining our team, click here.

Apply For Admission

Ready to join Wolf Nation? Click here to submit your application for admission to the College.

Performing Arts

Musical Ensembles

The Newberry College Music Department is proud to offer a variety of performing ensembles, open to all students, regardless of major:

Instrumental

Jazz Big Band

Jazz Combo*

Newberry Chamber Orchestra

Scarlet Spirit Marching Band

Wind Ensemble

Choral

College Singers

Madrigals*

* denotes group participation by audition

Ensemble participation offers the opportunity to make lifelong friends, enhance musical ability, and travel to new and exciting places, all while earning scholarships and credit toward your degree. To learn more about musical ensembles, reach out to the Department of Music.

Theatre

Regardless of your major, if you have a passion for acting, production, and sharing your talents, there is a place for you in the student theatre. With our Lookin' Sharp Improv Team, semesterly plays, and biannual musicals, there are plenty of opportunities to "break a leg." To learn more about theatre, reach out to Professor Mandy Butler.

Speech & Debate

Newberry College's Speech & Debate Team allows students to hone their speaking and performing skills and compete against their peers across the country. No prior experience is required, students in any program of study can join, and scholarships are available. Click here to learn more.

Fitness Center

The fitness center is a place for students, faculty and staff to get a good workout and meet their health and fitness goals. The fitness center provides a variety of cardio equipment, free weights, and weight machines. Housed in the O.L. Casey Center, the facility is available Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. until 10 p.m.
